description:
14.5 color_vulkan
Video source that creates a Vulkan frame of a solid color.
Useful for benchmarking, or overlaying.

It accepts the following parameters:
name: color_vulkan

options.description: The color to use. Either a name, or a hexadecimal value. The default value is black.
options.name: color

options.description: The size of the output frame. Default value is 1920x1080.
options.name: size

options.description: The framerate to output at. Default value is 60 frames per second.
options.name: rate

options.description: The video signal aspect ratio. Default value is 1/1.
options.name: sar

options.description: The pixel format of the output Vulkan frames. Default value is yuv444p.
options.name: format

options.description:
Set the output YCbCr sample range.

This allows the autodetected value to be overridden as well as allows forcing a specific value used for the output and encoder. If not specified, the range depends on the pixel format. Possible values:

‘auto/unknown’

Choose automatically.

‘jpeg/full/pc’

Set full range (0-255 in case of 8-bit luma).

‘mpeg/limited/tv’

Set "MPEG" range (16-235 in case of 8-bit luma).
options.name: out_range
